News.Title: Premier Limited Reports Q3 FY26 Loss of Rs 175 Lakhs
News.Summary: Premier Limited, under CIRP since January 2021, reported a net loss of Rs 175 lakhs for Q3 FY26. Manufacturing operations remain suspended since March 2020 due to lack of working capital.

News.Title: Premier Energies Commissions 400 MW Solar Facility
News.Summary: Premier Energies commissioned a 400 MW solar cell manufacturing facility in Telangana as part of its Rs 11,000-crore expansion plan to double manufacturing capacities by 2028.

News.Title: Premier Energies Plans Cost Transfer Strategy
News.Summary: Premier Energies announces strategy to maintain profit margins by transferring increased operational costs to customers through pricing adjustments.

News.Title: Premier Energies Sees 30GW Demand Growth Ahead
News.Summary: Premier Energies management expects total market demand to reach 30GW, with no oversupply concerns due to measured capacity addition pace. Company remains optimistic about market dynamics in coming years.

News.Title: Premier Energies Expects 70-75% Order Book Execution
News.Summary: Premier Energies management projects execution of 70-75% of its order book within the next 12 months, while anticipating minimal profit impact from rising commodity prices during recent conference call.

News.Title: Premier Energies Hedges Silver Price Risk for 6 Months
News.Summary: Premier Energies has secured a hedge against silver price increases for up to 6 months, providing protection against commodity price volatility in its operations.

News.Title: Premier Energies Plans ₹30 Billion Capex for 2026
News.Summary: Premier Energies announces ambitious capital expenditure plan of ₹30 billion for 2026, signaling major expansion and growth initiatives across its operations.

News.Title: Premier Energies Secures 9.4 GW Solar Orders
News.Summary: Premier Energies has secured significant orders totaling 9.4 GW for solar cells and modules, with delivery scheduled by FY28, marking a major milestone in the company's solar manufacturing business.

News.Title: Premier Energies Projects ₹10 Billion Transformer Revenue
News.Summary: Premier Energies announces ambitious projection of ₹10 billion revenue from transformer business over the next 2 to 2.5 years, signaling significant expansion in power infrastructure segment.

News.Title: Premier Energies Q3 profit jumps 53% to ₹392 cr
News.Summary: Premier Energies reported strong Q3 results with net profit surging 53.5% YoY to ₹391.70 crore. Revenue grew 13% to ₹1,936.40 crore while EBITDA margin expanded to 30.6%. Shares gained 5% following the results.

News.Title: Premier Explosives Secures ₹17.68 Cr International Order
News.Summary: Premier Explosives receives USD 1.93 million rocket motor order while four other companies secure contracts worth ₹3.30-32 crores across defence, IT, recycling and infrastructure sectors.

News.Title: Premier Polyfilm hits 20% upper circuit on strong Q3
News.Summary: Premier Polyfilm shares locked at 20% upper circuit after reporting impressive Q3 FY26 results with net profit surging 39% YoY to ₹9.28 crore and sales rising 28% to ₹79.30 crore.

News.Title: Premier Energies Plans ₹11,000 Cr Expansion
News.Summary: Premier Energies announces massive expansion to add 7.4 GW cell and 6 GW module capacity annually, backed by ₹13,000 crore order book and government ALMM framework approval.

News.Title: Premier Energies Plans ₹11,000 Cr Expansion
News.Summary: Premier Energies announces massive capacity expansion adding 7.4 GW cell and 6 GW module manufacturing capacity with ₹11,000 crore investment, backed by ₹13,000 crore order book.

News.Title: Premier, Waaree Energies in Focus on China Tax Move
News.Summary: Premier Energies and Waaree Energies shares could gain attention as China announces removal of VAT rebates on solar cells and related products from April 2025, potentially benefiting Indian manufacturers.

News.Title: Premier Energies Among 10 Stocks Hit 52-Week Lows
News.Summary: Premier Energies and nine other prominent stocks across renewable energy, FMCG, retail, and pharmaceuticals hit fresh 52-week lows amid market volatility and sector-specific challenges.

News.Title: Bernstein Cuts Premier Target, Warns of Solar Oversupply
News.Summary: Bernstein maintains bearish stance on Premier and Waaree Energies despite calling them good companies, citing oversupply concerns and soft demand expectations in solar sector.

News.Title: Waaree Energies Falls 4.68% on Heavy Trading Volume
News.Summary: Waaree Energies shares declined 4.68% to Rs 2,724.30 with trading volume 3x above average at 1.54 lakh shares, showing continued weakness despite recent F&O inclusion.

News.Title: Premier Energies Completes First Tranche Acquisition
News.Summary: Premier Energies Limited successfully completed first tranche of Transcon Industrial Limited acquisition for ₹250.00 crores, securing 34.21% stake with revised timeline for remaining 51% shareholding by February 2026.

News.Title: Premier Limited Reports Rs 235.88 Lakh Loss During Insolvency Process
News.Summary: Premier Limited, currently under Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process since January 2021, reported unaudited financial results for the quarter ended September 30, 2025. The company recorded a loss of Rs 235.88 lakhs for the half-year period, with its net worth completely eroded. Manufacturing activities at the Chakan plant remain suspended since March 2020 due to lack of working capital. The Committee of Creditors had approved a resolution plan by Fab Metals Pvt. Ltd with 92.47% consent in January 2022, with approval from NCLT Mumbai Bench still pending. The company received compensation of Rs 164 lakhs from land acquisition by Dedicated Freight Corridor Corporation, which was treated as other income. Resolution Professional Kanak Jani is managing the company's affairs as the Board of Directors' powers remain suspended.

News.Title: Premier Limited Holds Twentieth Committee of Creditors Meeting Under Insolvency Process
News.Summary: Premier Limited, currently undergoing Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP), held its twentieth Committee of Creditors meeting on October 27, 2025, from 4:00 PM to 4:50 PM. The meeting was conducted under the supervision of Resolution Professional Kanak Jani. The company notified stock exchanges BSE and NSE about the meeting conclusion as part of regulatory disclosure requirements.

News.Title: Premier Energies Reports 72% Profit Surge in Q2 with Margin Expansion
News.Summary: Premier Energies Ltd reported consolidated net profit of ₹353.4 crore, up 72% from ₹205.9 crore in the same period last year. Revenue from operations increased 20.3% to ₹1,836.8 crore, while EBITDA grew 47.4% to ₹560.7 crore. Operating margins expanded to 30.53% from 25% previously. The company plans to expand its Solar PV Topcon Cell manufacturing facility at Naidupeta, Andhra Pradesh to 7 GW with an additional investment of ₹502 crore through its subsidiary Premier Energies Global Environment Pvt Ltd. The expansion will be financed through internal accruals and spread over FY26-27. The GST reduction on solar cells, modules and inverters from 12% to 5% is expected to lower project costs and boost consumer demand. Shares closed 0.89% lower at ₹1,090.20 on the NSE ahead of the earnings announcement.

News.Title: Premier Energies to Announce Q2 Results on October 28, Shares Rise 2.77% in Five Days
News.Summary: Premier Energies Ltd., a solar cells and modules manufacturer with 5.1 GW annual capacity, will announce its quarterly results on October 28. The Board of Directors meeting will consider audited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter and half year ended September 30, 2025. An earnings call is scheduled for October 29 at 10 a.m. The trading window has been closed since October 1 until 48 hours after results declaration. In the previous quarter, the company reported consolidated total income of Rs 1,869.52 crore, up 12% year-on-year, while net profit jumped 55.3% to Rs 307.79 crore. Premier Energies shares have gained 2.77% in the past five trading sessions and 6.90% over the last month, though they remain down 18.16% year-to-date. The stock hit a 52-week high of Rs 1,388 and a low of Rs 774.05, currently trading at Rs 1,090.

News.Title: Premier Energies Acquires 51% Stake in KSolare Energy for ₹86.7 Crore
News.Summary: Premier Energies' board approved the acquisition of a 51% stake in Pune-based KSolare Energy for ₹86.7 crore, marking its entry into solar inverter manufacturing. KSolare will become a subsidiary of Premier Energies, while Syrma SGS Technologies will acquire the remaining 49% stake for ₹83.3 crore. KSolare manufactures on-grid, off-grid, and hybrid solar inverters with an annual production capacity of 500,000 inverters. The company reported revenue of ₹342 crore in fiscal 2025, compared to ₹226 crore in FY24 and ₹145 crore in FY23. The acquisition allows Premier Energies to expand into the residential solar inverter market. The cash transaction is expected to close within 90 days, with both companies jointly managing KSolare's business through equal board representation.

News.Title: Premier Energies Acquires 51% Stake in Transcon Ind for Rs 500 Crore to Enter Power Transformer Business
News.Summary: Premier Energies Ltd. will acquire a majority 51% stake in Hyderabad-based Transcon Ind Ltd. for Rs 500 crore. Transcon Ind manufactures and sells various types of transformers. The acquisition allows Premier Energies to diversify into power transformer manufacturing and establish presence in this segment as part of becoming a full-spectrum energy solutions provider. The company expects operational and market synergies with its existing solar module manufacturing business, enabling integrated energy solutions and cross-selling opportunities. No government or regulatory approval is required, and the deal will complete within 90 days subject to preconditions. Premier Energies is India's second largest fully integrated solar cell and solar module manufacturer. The company will announce quarterly earnings on Oct. 28. Shares closed 0.9% higher at Rs 1,069 following the announcement, though the stock has declined 20% over the past 12 months while gaining 7% year-to-date.

News.Title: Premier Energies Secures $19.95 Million Solar Contract in West Africa Despite Share Decline
News.Summary: Premier Energies Ltd. won orders worth $19.95 million to supply and install solar power systems in the Republic of Benin. The project includes installing 750 rooftop solar systems at police stations, educational institutions, health centers and border surveillance units, along with over 4,400 solar streetlights and 650 solar water heaters. The initiative supports Benin's national goal to expand access to clean energy. Premier Energies will work with the General Directorate of Energy Planning and Rural Electrification under the Ministry of Energy, Water and Mines. The project will be financed through credit lines from India's EXIM Bank and ECOWAS Bank for Investment and Development. Despite the contract win, shares declined over 1% from opening price to trade at ₹1014.65. Managing Director Chiranjeev Saluja called the contract a strong endorsement of the company's operational capability and global competitiveness.

News.Title: Premier Energies Plans 10-11 GW Solar Manufacturing Capacity by FY27
News.Summary: Premier Energies targets manufacturing capacity of 10-11 GW for solar cells and modules by FY27, tripling its current capacity. Chief Business Officer Vinay Rustagi stated this expansion will have a proportional impact on the company's revenue. The company plans to diversify into batteries, inverters, and upstream solar manufacturing including ingots and wafers, projecting a three to four-fold revenue increase over the next two years. Government policies including import duties and mandates for domestic solar cells have boosted demand, growing Premier Energies' order book by over Rs 2,000 crore in two months to reach Rs 10,500 crore. The company will execute a Rs 12,500 crore capital expenditure plan over three years to indigenize the entire solar value chain. Rustagi expects India to become self-sufficient in solar cell manufacturing within 12-15 months, with Rs 50,000-60,000 crore of investments flowing into the sector. Premier Energies shares closed 0.4% lower at Rs 1,051.

News.Title: Premier Energies Shares Worth ₹18,000 Crore Become Eligible for Trading as Lock-in Period Ends
News.Summary: Premier Energies' one-year shareholder lock-in period ended on September 1, making 185.2 crore shares (41% of outstanding equity) worth ₹18,347 crore eligible for trading. The company debuted on September 3 last year at over 100% premium to its ₹450 IPO price, reaching a high of ₹1,388 per share before correcting. Promoters hold 64.25% stake as of June quarter. Mutual fund ownership increased to 8.34% from 4.22% over 12 months, while foreign institutional ownership rose to 4.41% from 3.08%. Small retail shareholders declined from 4.05 lakh to 3.7 lakh. Management indicated strong order visibility for the second quarter with EBITDA margins expected to remain at current levels. June quarter margins expanded to 30.2% from 21.6% previously. Shares closed at ₹990.7, down 30% from post-listing highs but above IPO price.

News.Title: MPL to Cut 60% of India Workforce Following Government Ban on Paid Gaming
News.Summary: Mobile Premier League (MPL) will eliminate approximately 300 of its 500 India employees across marketing, finance, operations, engineering and legal divisions after the government banned online paid games citing financial and addiction risks. The ban has shut down many gaming apps offering paid fantasy cricket, rummy and poker games, shocking an industry backed by venture capital firms that was projected to reach $3.6 billion by 2029. India represented 50% of MPL's revenues, with the company generating roughly $100 million from the market last year. CEO Sai Srinivas stated the company will no longer generate revenue from India in the near future as it shifts focus to free-to-play games and its U.S. market operations. MPL was valued at $2.3 billion in 2021 and is backed by Peak XV Partners. Rival Dream11, valued at $8 billion, has also discontinued its fantasy cricket offering, while gaming company A23 has challenged the ban in court.

News.Title: Premier Energies Launches India's First 620W DCR Topcon Solar Modules Despite Share Decline
News.Summary: Premier Energies announced the commercial operation of its 1.2 GW N-Type G12R solar cell line and launched high-efficiency 620W Domestic Content Requirement compliant Topcon solar modules, becoming one of the first companies in India to introduce G12R N-Type solar cell technology. The modules feature Tunnel Oxide Passivated Contact architecture, delivering higher power density, improved temperature performance, and stronger low-light efficiency. MD and CEO Chiranjeev Saluja described this as a significant milestone in India's transition to high-efficiency solar technology. The rectangular G12R format is designed for utility-scale solar parks, commercial installations, and industrial rooftops, offering superior conversion efficiency compared to conventional PERC modules. The modules are engineered to withstand India's challenging climatic conditions including high heat, humidity, dust and strong winds. Despite the product launch announcement, Premier Energies shares declined 0.76% to ₹1,014.9.

News.Title: Premier Limited Reports Narrowed Losses Despite Zero Revenue as CIRP Resolution Plan Awaits NCLT Approval
News.Summary: Premier Limited announced its quarterly results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025, while under Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process (CIRP). The company reported zero revenue from operations, continuing its trend of suspended manufacturing activities at the Chakan plant since March 3, 2020, due to lack of working capital. Net loss narrowed to Rs. 194 lakhs from Rs. 233 lakhs in the previous quarter, primarily due to reduced total expenses of Rs. 221 lakhs. Other income stood at Rs. 28 lakhs. The Committee of Creditors has approved a resolution plan submitted by Fab Metals Pvt. Ltd. with 92.47% assent, but NCLT approval remains pending. The company's net worth has been completely eroded, and auditors have raised multiple qualifications regarding material uncertainty about going concern status, lack of impairment assessment for assets, and various compliance issues including non-appointment of Company Secretary and internal auditor. The Resolution Professional, Ms. Kanak Jani, manages the company as Board powers remain suspended during CIRP.

News.Title: Premier Explosives Shares Jump Nearly 10% on Rs 190 Crore Defense Export Order
News.Summary: Premier Explosives received an export order worth Rs 190 crore to manufacture and supply defense explosives, with delivery to be completed within two years. The company did not disclose the name of the international entity that placed the order. This follows a previous Rs 22.6 crore purchase order from another international entity for rocket motors to be delivered by March 31, 2026. The stock price surged 9.72% to Rs 467.75, breaking an eight-day losing streak during which it had declined 21%. The stock later pared gains to trade 5.07% higher at Rs 448. Premier Explosives has declined 30.32% over the past 12 months and 14.26% year-to-date. Trading volume reached 3.4 times the 30-day average, and the relative strength index stood at 29.18, indicating oversold conditions.

News.Title: Premier Explosives Secures ₹22 Crore Export Order for Rocket Motors Despite Stock Decline
News.Summary: Premier Explosives received an export order worth ₹22.36 crore for supplying rocket motors to an international client, with delivery expected by March 31, 2026. The company previously secured another export order worth ₹105 crore for defence explosives earlier this month. In the fourth quarter, the Secunderabad-based company's revenue declined 15% to ₹74 crore, while EBITDA fell 37% year-on-year. The company maintains an order book of ₹750 crore. Premier Explosives manufactures industrial explosives and detonators for mining, infrastructure, defence and space industries, with 81% of revenue coming from defence and space segments. The company also provides operation and maintenance services for ISRO and DRDO facilities. Despite the recent order wins, shares have declined over 19% in the past month and traded 2.4% lower at ₹445.6.

News.Title: Premier Energies Reports 53% EBITDA Growth in June Quarter with Order Book Above ₹8,000 Crore
News.Summary: Premier Energies Ltd. delivered strong operational performance in the June quarter with revenue growing 10% year-on-year to ₹1,820.7 crore. EBITDA surged 53% to ₹548.3 crore, while EBITDA margins expanded significantly to 30.2% from 21.6% in the previous year. Net profit increased 55.4% to ₹307.8 crore compared to ₹198.1 crore last year. The company maintains a robust order book of ₹8,602 crore, entirely from domestic markets. The modules business generated 74% of revenue while cells contributed 23%. Premier Energies has outlined ambitious capacity expansion targets including 10 GW each for wafers & ingots and cells businesses over three years, plus 36,000 MT for aluminium frames and 110 GW modules capacity by financial year 2028. Despite strong results, shares closed 1.5% lower at ₹1,084.7 and remain 22% below recent 52-week highs.

News.Title: Premier Energies Reports 51% Jump in Quarterly Net Profit to 3 Billion Rupees
News.Summary: Premier Energies reported consolidated net profit of 3 billion rupees for the quarter, representing a 51% increase from 1.98 billion rupees in the same quarter last year and an 8% rise from 2.77 billion rupees in the previous quarter. The company's revenue reached 18 billion rupees, up 12.5% year-over-year from 16 billion rupees, while remaining flat compared to the previous quarter's 16 billion rupees.

News.Title: Premier Energies to Announce Q1 Results on July 26, Earnings Call Scheduled
News.Summary: Premier Energies Ltd. will announce its financial results for the quarter ended June 30 on Saturday, July 26. The Board will consider and approve unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results and deliberate on declaring an interim dividend for FY 2025-26. An earnings call with investors and analysts is scheduled for July 28 at 11 a.m. IST. The trading window for company securities has been closed since July 1 and will remain closed until 48 hours after results declaration. In the previous quarter (Q4FY25), the company reported consolidated revenue of Rs 1,621 crore, down 5% from the prior quarter, while net profit increased 9% to Rs 278 crore. Premier Energies shares have gained 5.62% in the last five trading sessions and 8.59% in the previous month, though they are down nearly 17% year-to-date.

News.Title: Premier Explosives Benefits from Strong Defence Sector Performance and International Orders
News.Summary: The NSE defence stocks index has outperformed the benchmark 50 companies this year, driven by growing interest in India's defence manufacturing ecosystem. Premier Explosives, a mid-cap defence company, is capitalizing on this positive sentiment with multiple international orders secured.
